A month ago, I participated in my first-ever hackathon â€” Hacknight 7.0, organized by ACM PESU-ECC.
It was an incredible experience where our task was to solve issues in existing repositories and make open-source contributions.

I learned a lot about:

  • âš™ï¸ Understanding real-world codebases
  • ğŸŒ Collaborating on GitHub
  • ğŸ§© Managing issues, pull requests, and version control
  • ğŸ’¡ The spirit of open source â€” learning, contributing, and growing together

Hackathons like these remind me that learning doesnâ€™t always need a win â€” sometimes, participation itself is the prize.

Grateful to ACM PESU-ECC for organizing such an inspiring event and to all the participants who made it such a memorable experience!
